Package me.yleoft.zAPI.handlers

Interface PlaceholdersHandler

public interface PlaceholdersHandler
Base handler for plugin-defined placeholders.

Implementations should define their placeholders via getPlaceholders() and implement onPlaceholderRequest(OfflinePlayer, String, List) for MiniPlaceholders, and override applyHookPlaceholders(OfflinePlayer, String) for PAPI's raw param parsing when the placeholder structure is too complex for simple key+args routing.

    • getPlaceholders

      @NotNull @NotNull List<PlaceholderDefinition> getPlaceholders()
      Returns the list of placeholder definitions this handler provides.

      These definitions are used to register placeholders with MiniPlaceholders. Each definition declares a key, how many colon-separated arguments it expects, and a PlaceholderType that controls how it is registered.

      Returns:
      A list of placeholder definitions

    • onPlaceholderRequest

      @Nullable @Nullable String onPlaceholderRequest(@Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player, @NotNull @NotNull String key, @NotNull @NotNull List<String> parameters)
      Called when a placeholder value is requested via MiniPlaceholders. Also used as the common entry point when PAPI params can be cleanly routed.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to resolve the placeholder for (may be null for GLOBAL placeholders)
      key - The placeholder key (e.g., "home_world", "set")
      parameters - The parameter values in order (e.g., ["1"] or ["1", "2"])
      Returns:
      The replacement string, or null if not handled

    • applyHookPlaceholders

      @Nullable default @Nullable String applyHookPlaceholders(@Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player, @NotNull @NotNull String params)
      Handles PlaceholderAPI's raw params string.

      Override this for complex PAPI parsing (e.g., player prefixes, optional params, variable-depth structures). The default implementation tries to match against registered PlaceholderDefinitions.

      Supports player_<name>_<key>_<args> syntax for PlaceholderType.PLAYER_TARGETED placeholders. For example: %zhomes_player_Steve_home_1% resolves "home" for player "Steve" with arg "1".

      Parameters:
      player - The player to apply placeholders for
      params - The raw placeholder params (the part after the identifier prefix)
      Returns:
      The replacement, or null if not handled

    • applyPlaceholders

      default String applyPlaceholders(@Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player, @NotNull @NotNull String text)
      Applies plugin placeholders in a given text for a specific player. Supports both PAPI-style %identifier_...% and MiniPlaceholders-style <identifier_...:args> placeholders.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to apply placeholders for
      text - The text containing placeholders
      Returns:
      The text with placeholders replaced
